Deep Learning

Deep learning is the algorithm powering the current renaissance of artificial intelligence (AI). Its progress is not showing signs of slowing down. A McKinsey report estimates that by 2030, AI will potentially deliver $13 trillion to the global economy, or 16% of the world's current GDP. This opens up exciting career opportunities in the coming decade. However, deep learning can be daunting to learn. With the abundance of learning resources in recent years has emerged another problem - formation overload. This book aims to compress this knowledge and make the subject approachable. By the end of this book, you will be able to build a visual intuition about deep learning and neural networks.

Key Concepts:

  • Artificial Intelligence (AI)
  • Machine Learning (ML)
  • Deep Learning (DL)
  • The role of prediction in decision-making under uncertainty
  • How experience affects prediction accuracy
  • Examples of prediction in language translation and business experience
Artificial Intelligence Machine Learning Deep Learning prediction decision-making uncertainty experience language translation business experience
Data Science Intermediate
